channel.title: Logarithms
channel.description:
Express as a logarithm of a single number or expression: log[sub]a[/sub] 3 + log[sub]a[/sub] 4 = (my answer) log[sub]a[/sub] 7
Is that correct?
EDIT: nvm it's log[sub]a[/sub] 12 how about this: 1/2(log[sub]b[/sub] x - log[sub]b[/sub] y) = (my answer) log[sub]b[/sub] x/y

item.title: Logarithms
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

and:

(log[sub]b[/sub]X + log[sub]b[/sub]Y) = log[sub]b[/sub]XY
log[sub]b[/sub]X[sup]n[/sup] = n*log[sub]b[/sub]X

Read full topic

item.title: Logarithms
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Original Daniel:

how does -logb y turn into /y? :S

(logb X - logb Y) is the same as logb(X/Y).

Read full topic

item.title: Logarithms
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

how does -logb y turn into /y? :S

item.title: Logarithms
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

1/2(log[sub]b[/sub] x - log[sub]b[/sub] y)
=1/2 log[sub]b/sub
=log[sub]b/sub[sup]1/2[/sup]

Read full topic

item.title: Logarithms
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“The Chubby Bunny, post:1, topic:328702”]how about this:
1/2(log[sub]b[/sub] x - log[sub]b[/sub] y) = (my answer) log[sub]b[/sub] x/y[/quote]

if I remember, it should be log[sub]b[/sub] sqrt(x/y)

Been a year since trig, and I don’t quite remember the laws of logarithms…

IIRC, the power rule states you take the power and bring it out front, (which is where the 1/2 comes from)

Read full topic

item.title: Logarithms

item.description:

Express as a logarithm of a single number or expression:
log[sub]a[/sub] 3 + log[sub]a[/sub] 4 = (my answer) log[sub]a[/sub] 7

Is that correct?

how about this:
